intro: Tarchonanthus minor, commonly known as the Cape daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy yellow-orange flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has hairy, narrow leaves and is often found in coastal and sandy soils. It is drought-tolerant and thrives in full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Tarchonanthus minor is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional African medicine.
